poem:
Salt and Screens

Last night's salt is re-salted,  
truth rinsed in studio light;  
a path becomes a product,  
a wound a franchise.  

Elsewhere, fat stars the turkey,  
quiz teams bray their loyalties,  
love is served with a bill.  

O God of the small,  
teach us again the hard taste  
of honesty without cameras.
